happy.text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
happy.author: Dalai Lama

happy.text: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
happy.author: E.E. Cummings

happy.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
happy.author: Mahatma Gandhi

happy.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
happy.author: Marcus Aurelius

happy.text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
happy.author: Omar Khayyam

happy.text: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
happy.author: John Lennon

happy.text: Happiness is a warm puppy.
happy.author: Charles M. Schulz

happy.text: The secret of being happy is accepting where you are in life and making the most out of everyday.
happy.author: Unknown

happy.text: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement.
happy.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

happy.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
happy.author: Dalai Lama

happy.text: Happiness is a direction, not a place.
happy.author: Sydney J. Harris

happy.text: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.
happy.author: Mark Twain

happy.text: If you want to be happy, be.
happy.author: Leo Tolstoy

happy.text: Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times.
happy.author: Aeschylus

happy.text: A smile is happiness you'll find right under your nose.
happy.author: Tom Wilson

happy.text: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved.
happy.author: Victor Hugo

happy.text: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.
happy.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

happy.text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it's all that matters.
happy.author: Audrey Hepburn

happy.text: Happiness is letting go of what you think your life is supposed to look like.
happy.author: Unknown

happy.text: The key to being happy is knowing you have the power to choose what to accept and what to let go.
happy.author: Dodinsky

sad.text: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
sad.author: Victor Hugo

sad.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
sad.author: Albert Einstein

sad.text: The pain you feel today is the strength you feel tomorrow.
sad.author: Unknown

sad.text: Sometimes you have to experience the bad, so you can learn to appreciate the good things that enter your life.
sad.author: Leon Brown

sad.text: The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain.
sad.author: Dolly Parton

sad.text: Life is not about waiting for the storm to pass, it's about learning to dance in the rain.
sad.author: Vivian Greene

sad.text: The greatest happiness is to scatter your enemy and drive him before you.
sad.author: Genghis Khan

sad.text: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
sad.author: Jean de La Fontaine

sad.text: The good life is not one immune to sadness but one in which suffering contributes to our development.
sad.author: Alain de Botton

sad.text: Tears are words that need to be written.
sad.author: Paulo Coelho

sad.text: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
sad.author: Jim Rohn

sad.text: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.
sad.author: Bob Dylan

sad.text: The heart will break, but broken live on.
sad.author: Lord Byron

sad.text: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
sad.author: Khalil Gibran

sad.text: Every human walks around with a certain kind of sadness. They may not show it, but it's there.
sad.author: Taraji P. Henson

sad.text: Some days are just bad days, that's all.
sad.author: Unknown

sad.text: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
sad.author: Carl Jung

sad.text: Sadness gives depth. Happiness gives height. Sadness gives roots. Happiness gives branches.
sad.author: Osho

sad.text: The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.
sad.author: Khalil Gibran

sad.text: There are moments when I wish I could roll back the clock and take all the sadness away, but I have a feeling that if I did, the joy would be gone as well.
sad.author: Nicholas Sparks

motivated.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
motivated.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

motivated.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
motivated.author: Winston Churchill

motivated.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
motivated.author: Steve Jobs

motivated.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
motivated.author: Sam Levenson

motivated.text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
motivated.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

motivated.text: The harder you work for something, the greater you'll feel when you achieve it.
motivated.author: Unknown

motivated.text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
motivated.author: Steve Jobs

motivated.text: The best revenge is massive success.
motivated.author: Frank Sinatra

motivated.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
motivated.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

motivated.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
motivated.author: Zig Ziglar

motivated.text: The difference between try and triumph is just a little umph!
motivated.author: Marvin Phillips

motivated.text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
motivated.author: Charles Kingsleigh

motivated.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
motivated.author: Winston Churchill

motivated.text: The future depends on what you do today.
motivated.author: Mahatma Gandhi

motivated.text: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
motivated.author: Roy T. Bennett

motivated.text: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
motivated.author: Unknown

motivated.text: Dream big and dare to fail.
motivated.author: Norman Vaughan

motivated.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
motivated.author: Mark Twain

motivated.text: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
motivated.author: Gary Player

motivated.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
motivated.author: Albert Schweitzer

relaxed.text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
relaxed.author: Confucius

relaxed.text: The time to relax is when you don't have time for it.
relaxed.author: Sydney J. Harris

relaxed.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
relaxed.author: Buddha

relaxed.text: Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is relax.
relaxed.author: Mark Black

relaxed.text: Your calm mind is the ultimate weapon against your challenges.
relaxed.author: Bryant McGill

relaxed.text: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a bountiful crop.
relaxed.author: Ovid

relaxed.text: The time to relax is when you don't have time for it.
relaxed.author: Jim Goodwin

relaxed.text: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.
relaxed.author: Anne Lamott

relaxed.text: Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.
relaxed.author: Chinese Proverb

relaxed.text: There is more to life than increasing its speed.
relaxed.author: Mahatma Gandhi

relaxed.text: Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees on a summer's day, listening to the murmur of the water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is by no means a waste of time.
relaxed.author: John Lubbock

relaxed.text: Sometimes the most important thing in a whole day is the rest we take between two deep breaths.
relaxed.author: Etty Hillesum

relaxed.text: Slow down and everything you are chasing will come around and catch you.
relaxed.author: John De Paola

relaxed.text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
relaxed.author: William James

relaxed.text: Don't underestimate the value of doing nothing, of just going along, listening to all the things you can't hear, and not bothering.
relaxed.author: Winnie the Pooh

relaxed.text: Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be.
relaxed.author: Eckhart Tolle

relaxed.text: Relax. No one else knows what they're doing either.
relaxed.author: Unknown

relaxed.text: Take a deep breath. It's just a bad day, not a bad life.
relaxed.author: Unknown

relaxed.text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
relaxed.author: Lao Tzu

relaxed.text: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
relaxed.author: Ram Dass

energetic.text: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
energetic.author: Benjamin Franklin

energetic.text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
energetic.author: Albert Einstein

energetic.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
energetic.author: Steve Jobs

energetic.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
energetic.author: Albert Schweitzer

energetic.text: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
energetic.author: Aristotle

energetic.text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
energetic.author: Helen Keller

energetic.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
energetic.author: C.S. Lewis

energetic.text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
energetic.author: Pablo Picasso

energetic.text: The future depends on what you do today.
energetic.author: Mahatma Gandhi

energetic.text: Don't count the days, make the days count.
energetic.author: Muhammad Ali

energetic.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
energetic.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

energetic.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
energetic.author: Winston Churchill

energetic.text: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
energetic.author: Gary Player

energetic.text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
energetic.author: Charles Kingsleigh

energetic.text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
energetic.author: Steve Jobs

energetic.text: The best revenge is massive success.
energetic.author: Frank Sinatra

energetic.text: Dream big and dare to fail.
energetic.author: Norman Vaughan

energetic.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
energetic.author: Mark Twain

energetic.text: The difference between try and triumph is just a little umph!
energetic.author: Marvin Phillips

energetic.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
energetic.author: Zig Ziglar

peaceful.text: Peace begins with a smile.
peaceful.author: Mother Teresa

peaceful.text: Serenity is not freedom from the storm, but peace amid the storm.
peaceful.author: Unknown

peaceful.text: In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.
peaceful.author: Deepak Chopra

peaceful.text: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
peaceful.author: Wayne W. Dyer

peaceful.text: When you do the right thing, you get the feeling of peace and serenity associated with it.
peaceful.author: Roy T. Bennett

peaceful.text: Peace is liberty in tranquility.
peaceful.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

peaceful.text: Nobody can bring you peace but yourself.
peaceful.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

peaceful.text: Peace comes from being able to contribute the best that we have, and all that we are, toward creating a world that supports everyone.
peaceful.author: Hafsat Abiola

peaceful.text: If you are depressed you are living in the past. If you are anxious you are living in the future. If you are at peace you are living in the present.
peaceful.author: Lao Tzu

peaceful.text: Do not let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.
peaceful.author: Dalai Lama

peaceful.text: Peace is a journey of a thousand miles and it must be taken one step at a time.
peaceful.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

peaceful.text: You find peace not by rearranging the circumstances of your life, but by realizing who you are at the deepest level.
peaceful.author: Eckhart Tolle

peaceful.text: Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
peaceful.author: Ronald Reagan

peaceful.text: When you make peace with yourself, you make peace with the world.
peaceful.author: Maha Ghosananda

peaceful.text: Peace is not something you wish for; it's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.
peaceful.author: Robert Fulghum

peaceful.text: Inner peace begins the moment you choose not to allow another person or event to control your emotions.
peaceful.author: Pema Chodron

peaceful.text: Peace is always beautiful.
peaceful.author: Walt Whitman

peaceful.text: The life of inner peace, being harmonious and without stress, is the easiest type of existence.
peaceful.author: Norman Vincent Peale

peaceful.text: Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.
peaceful.author: Robert J. Sawyer

peaceful.text: Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal.
peaceful.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

anxious.text: Anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strength.
anxious.author: Charles Spurgeon

anxious.text: You don't have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you.
anxious.author: Dan Millman

anxious.text: Trust yourself. You've survived a lot, and you'll survive whatever is coming.
anxious.author: Robert Tew

anxious.text: Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow.
anxious.author: Swedish Proverb

anxious.text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.
anxious.author: Walter Anderson

anxious.text: Present fears are less than horrible imaginings.
anxious.author: William Shakespeare

anxious.text: Anxiety is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged, it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.
anxious.author: Arthur Somers Roche

anxious.text: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.
anxious.author: Deepak Chopra

anxious.text: Anxiety's like a rocking chair. It gives you something to do, but it doesn't get you very far.
anxious.author: Jodi Picoult

anxious.text: Don't let your mind bully your body into believing it must carry the burden of its worries.
anxious.author: Astrid Alauda

anxious.text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
anxious.author: William James

anxious.text: Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it.
anxious.author: Dorothy M. Neddermeyer

anxious.text: Anxiety happens when you think you have to figure out everything all at once.
anxious.author: Karen Salmansohn

anxious.text: You can't always control what goes on outside, but you can always control what goes on inside.
anxious.author: Wayne Dyer

anxious.text: The way you tell your story to yourself matters.
anxious.author: Amy Cuddy

anxious.text: Anxiety was born in the very same moment as mankind. And since we will never be able to master it, we will have to learn to live with it—just as we have learned to live with storms.
anxious.author: Paulo Coelho

anxious.text: Just when you feel you have no time to relax, know that this is the moment you most need to make time to relax.
anxious.author: Matt Haig

anxious.text: Anxiety is one little tree in your forest. Step back and look at the whole forest.
anxious.author: Unknown

anxious.text: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
anxious.author: William S. Burroughs

anxious.text: Sometimes the most important thing in a whole day is the rest we take between two deep breaths.
anxious.author: Etty Hillesum

grateful.text: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
grateful.author: Aesop

grateful.text: The more grateful I am, the more beauty I see.
grateful.author: Mary Davis

grateful.text: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
grateful.author: Henry Ward Beecher

grateful.text: When we focus on our gratitude, the tide of disappointment goes out and the tide of love rushes in.
grateful.author: Kristin Armstrong

grateful.text: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
grateful.author: Melody Beattie

grateful.text: Gratitude is the healthiest of all human emotions.
grateful.author: Zig Ziglar

grateful.text: When you are grateful, fear disappears and abundance appears.
grateful.author: Tony Robbins

grateful.text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues but the parent of all others.
grateful.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

grateful.text: The root of joy is gratefulness.
grateful.author: David Steindl-Rast

grateful.text: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life.
grateful.author: Melody Beattie

grateful.text: Gratitude is the memory of the heart.
grateful.author: Jean Baptiste Massieu

grateful.text: When gratitude becomes your default setting, life changes.
grateful.author: Nancy Leigh DeMoss

grateful.text: Gratitude and attitude are not challenges; they are choices.
grateful.author: Robert Braathe

grateful.text: Gratitude is riches. Complaint is poverty.
grateful.author: Doris Day

grateful.text: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.
grateful.author: Aesop

grateful.text: Gratitude is the most exquisite form of courtesy.
grateful.author: Jacques Maritain

grateful.text: Gratitude is a powerful catalyst for happiness.
grateful.author: Amy Collette

grateful.text: Gratitude is the ability to experience life as a gift.
grateful.author: John Ortberg

grateful.text: Gratitude makes everything enough.
grateful.author: Unknown

grateful.text: Gratitude is the wine for the soul. Go on. Get drunk.
grateful.author: Rumi

creative.text: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
creative.author: Albert Einstein

creative.text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.
creative.author: Pablo Picasso

creative.text: You can't use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
creative.author: Maya Angelou

creative.text: Creativity takes courage.
creative.author: Henri Matisse

creative.text: The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.
creative.author: Sylvia Plath

creative.text: Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
creative.author: Scott Adams

creative.text: To practice any art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow.
creative.author: Kurt Vonnegut

creative.text: The creative adult is the child who survived.
creative.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

creative.text: Creativity is just connecting things.
creative.author: Steve Jobs

creative.text: You see things and you say 'Why?' But I dream things that never were and I say 'Why not?'
creative.author: George Bernard Shaw

creative.text: Creativity is inventing, experimenting, growing, taking risks, breaking rules, making mistakes, and having fun.
creative.author: Mary Lou Cook

creative.text: The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.
creative.author: Pablo Picasso

creative.text: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
creative.author: Erich Fromm

creative.text: Every artist was first an amateur.
creative.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

creative.text: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
creative.author: Albert Einstein

creative.text: To be creative means to be in love with life.
creative.author: Osho

creative.text: Creativity is a wild mind and a disciplined eye.
creative.author: Dorothy Parker

creative.text: Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity.
creative.author: Ray Bradbury

creative.text: Creativity is the greatest expression of liberty.
creative.author: Bryant H. McGill

creative.text: The creative process is a process of surrender, not control.
creative.author: Julia Cameron
